alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 15 at 9:27PM PDT until May 22 at 4:27PM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures this week into next weekend will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. For the Stehekin River...including Stehekin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MAY 22ND... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until May 22nd. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 9:00 PM PDT Monday the stage was 24.2 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to 25.3 feet late Tuesday evening. It will then rise to 25.8 feet by Friday. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.7 feet on 05/15/1949. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Tuesday afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
